text:
Created attachment 30510
example JMX using Math.max()

When I'm trying to use a javaScript function with more than one parameter (e.g. ${__javaScript(Math.max(2,5))} or with variables ${__javaScript(Math.max(${x},${y}))}), then I get always an exception like:

sebb@apache.org
text:
Bugzilla is not a support forum.

Please subscribe to the JMeter user list and ask there.

creator: dlade@web.de
text:
(In reply to Sebb from comment #1)
> Bugzilla is not a support forum.
> 
> Please subscribe to the JMeter user list and ask there.

What do you mean by "not a support forum"? 
I try to use this function in UserDefinedVariables of JMeter and always get that exception but the JavaScript-Document says everything is fine.

Therefore something is wrong sending the parameters from JMeter to the JavaScript-Engine or maybe a bug in this engine.

But how can _I_ decide where the error could be?

Hello,
The process is :
- ask first on mailing list
- If you do not get answer after a while, you can open a bug


Regarding your issue, you will see it does not seem to be a bug
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text:
If someone ever searches the internet for the exception written above here he will find a solution.

"http://jmeter.apache.org/usermanual/functions.html" writes: 
If a function parameter contains a comma, then be sure to escape this with "\", otherwise JMeter will treat it as a parameter delimiter.

Because the exception is not mentioned in the document "googling" is not very useful. But further generations of Google users will find it now ...

JM2C
creator: dlade@web.de
